articles.title: CCTV captures the moment Rishabh Pant's speeding Mercedes crashes into a divider
articles.description: Cricketer Rishabh Pant's Mercedes car--as it crashed into a divider-- was caught on a security camera.
articles.content: The Tribune, now published from Chandigarh, started publication on February 2, 1881, in Lahore (now in Pakistan). It was started by Sardar Dyal Singh Majithia, a public-spirited philanthropist, and i… [+505 chars]

articles.author: Aaron Weinman
articles.title: From Chris Gayle to DJ Havana Brown: How a raft of stars landed on one of the country’s most controversial cricket matches
articles.description: Some of West Indies and Sri Lanka’s biggest cricket celebrities played for a talent manager accused of stealing $250,000.
articles.content: Nav De Silva, as he is known among friends, is described by teammates as soft-spoken behind the stumps, an unusual trait for wicketkeepers. One person says De Silva, 35, was so subdued on the field t… [+14147 chars]

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
